# Discord Chat Analysis for 💻│developers

## 1. Summary:
The discussion primarily revolves around advanced development techniques for Hyperfy worlds. 3rdEyeVisuals shared details about a "Miniverse.hyp" project that creates worlds-within-worlds, allowing for multiple communities to coexist in a single Hyperfy space with customized environments. This implementation required exposing player position and camera controls at the source code level to enable proximity toggles and prevent camera clipping. 3rdEyeVisuals also mentioned opening direct access to the THREE.js engine for in-world development, enabling integration of complex THREE.js simulations within Hyperfy. Other technical topics included snap points in Blender (described as empties with string-type custom properties set to "node" with value "snap"), and a brief mention of WebGPU as a potential upgrade path from WebGL to enable DX12 capabilities in the browser, potentially allowing for real-time ray tracing.

## 2. FAQ:
Q: How are snap points implemented in Blender? (implied by .hyp shaman) A: They are basically empties with string-type custom properties set to "node" and the value is "snap" (answered by .hyp shaman)
Q: Has anyone tried upgrading from WebGL to WebGPU? (asked by 3rdEyeVisuals) A: It has been discussed before in the channel (answered by Valiant)
Q: Is there an app/hyp file for the v1 image uploader that comes with a frame? (asked by untitled, xyz) A: Unanswered
